channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Esther Dingley: Missing hiker's boyfriend finds her body
item.description: The body and belongings of Esther Dingley are found close to where a bone fragment was discovered.

item.title: M1: Two children die in crash near junction 14
item.description: A 35-year-old woman is arrested and remains in custody, police say.

item.title: Woman found dead in Perton lay-by was set alight
item.description: Police are still trying to identify the woman, who they say is aged between her mid-teens to late 20s.

item.title: Megan Newborough: Murder charge after missing woman found dead
item.description: The body of 23-year-old Megan Newborough was discovered in Leicestershire on Sunday.

item.title: Victoria station: One dead and two injured in bus crash
item.description: Two buses were involved in a crash during rush hour outside Victoria train station in London.

item.title: Smitten prison officer helped inmate lover escape
item.description: Erica Whittingham met prisoner Michael Seddon after her marriage broke down, a court hears.

item.title: Hermit crabs 'excited' by plastic additive
item.description: An additive in the waste may resemble a chemical normally found in food sources, a study says.

item.title: Tributes to boy hit by mirror in department store
item.description: Freddie Farrow died days after being struck by a mirror in a High Street department store.

item.title: Harwich lifeboat appoints charity's first female coxswain
item.description: Di Bush makes history after becoming the RNLI's first full-time female coxswain.

item.title: Bilsdale transmitter fire: TV and radio disrupted in 1m homes
item.description: More than a million people across North Yorkshire and parts of the North East were affected.

item.title: Body found in search for diver missing off Jurassic Coast
item.description: Carvalho da Silveira was last seen in the water on Saturday afternoon.

item.title: Sheffield Link FM radio station faces sanction over 'Jihadi' chant
item.description: An Islamic chant "encouraging violent Jihad" was broadcast by Sheffield-based Link FM, Ofcom says.

item.title: A-Level results: Hackney twins secure Oxbridge places
item.description: Emmanuel and Ebenezer Boakye say growing up in a single-parent family made them determined to thrive.

item.title: A-level results: 'We've put in the work and we deserve these grades'
item.description: Students in England, Wales and Northern Ireland are told their A-level and BTec results.

item.title: A-level results: Teenage refugee can finally pursue medicine dream
item.description: Zainab Fadhal, who moved to the UK from Iraq, will join the University of Leeds in September.

item.title: A-levels 2021: What you need to know about this year's results
item.description: For the second year running, pupils in England, Wales and Northern Ireland have not taken the exams.

item.title: BTec results 2021: What are they and when are results out?
item.description: When will BTec results be out and how will the grades be reached?

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Galal Yafai returns to UK from Tokyo
item.description: Galal Yafai was met with cheers and chanting as he arrived at London Heathrow Airport from Tokyo.

item.title: Alex Reid death: Mother completes 624-mile run for heart screening charity
item.description: Heather Reid completes mammoth run in honour of daughter who died from undetected heart condition.

item.title: Birmingham riots: Tariq Jahan reflects 10 years on
item.description: Tariq Jahan says he forgives the men who killed his son during the 2011 riots in Birmingham.

item.title: ‘Parkinson’s doesn't stop me playing tennis’
item.description: Andy Wright, who was diagnosed at 33, says his return to the sport helps alleviate symptoms.

item.title: 'Walking to space was the best day of my life'
item.description: Tim, aged nine, walked 62 miles - the distance between Earth's atmosphere and the boundary of space.

item.title: Streatham attack: CCTV of Sudesh Amman's final moments shown at inquest
item.description: Jurors also watched the aftermath of the shooting as police removed Sudesh Amman's hoax suicide belt.

item.title: Nottinghamshire boxer, 64, ends career with world title win
item.description: Steve Ward, previously recognised as the world's oldest male boxer, secures his fairy tale ending.

item.title: Max Woosey: Camping challenge boy set for 500th night
item.description: Max Woosey will be spending the milestone night sleeping in a shelter in the woods.

item.title: Cotheridge murder-accused said dead man 'out of the way'
item.description: Mark Chilman, who denies killing Neil Parkinson, claims his words are "what police wanted to hear".

item.title: 'Preserved human remains' found in jar by builders in Toxteth
item.description: The jar was found in an unoccupied house in a street near Toxteth Park Cemetery, police say.

item.title: Bronze handle suggests 'lions used' in Roman Britain executions
item.description: The bronze key handle found in Leicester shows a "Barbarian" grappling with a lion.

item.title: The Hundred: London Spirit beat Manchester Originals by six runs in thriller
item.description: London Spirit win their first match in the men's Hundred by beating Manchester Originals at Old Trafford.

item.title: Derby beat Salford on pens in EFL Cup
item.description: Derby hold their nerve in a penalty shootout after coming back from 2-0 and 3-2 down in normal time to beat Salford in the EFL Cup.

item.title: England v India: Moeen Ali added to squad for second Test at Lord's
item.description: Worcestershire all-rounder Moeen Ali is added to the England squad for the second Test against India at Lord's.

item.title: Morecambe stun Blackburn in EFL Cup
item.description: Morecambe come from behind to earn a famous win at Blackburn in the first round of the Carabao Cup.

item.title: Social media abuse: Twitter says UK 'by far' main origin of comments after Euro 2020 final
item.description: The UK was "by far" the main origin of the "abhorrent racist abuse" on Twitter after England lost the Euro 2020 final, says the social media platform.
